question:
Consider the following statements:
1. 1987 INC session was presided by Badruddin Tyabji
2. 1995 INC session was presided by Rahimatullah M Sayani
3. 1940 session was presided by Abul Kalam Azad

How many of the above statements are correct?

Consider the following statements:
1. 69th amendment provided Delhi with legislature
2. 70th amendment is related to election of the president
3. 91st amendment is related to strength of the council of ministers
4. 104th amendment removed reservation for Anglo Indians in the lok sabha and state legislature

How many of the above statements are correct?

Consider the following statements:
1. 86th amendment amended the fundamental rights
2. 89th amendment is established the NCST as constitutional body
3. 91st amendment is related to strength of the council of ministers
4. 102nd amendment established NCOBC as constitutional body

How many of the above statements are correct?

Consider the following statements:
1. Article 54 deals with electoral college for the election of the president
2. Article 55 deals with manner of election of the president
3. Article 57 deals with qualification for the election of the president
4. Article 60 deals with impeachment of the president

How many of the above statements are correct?
Which of the following is not mentioned in the constitution?

options.text: The judge of the SC shall be in the office until they attain the age of 65 years
In the case of appointment of the judges other then the CJI, the CJI shall always be consulted
The procedure for the removal of the SC judges #ans

question:
Independence of judiciary from executive and legislature ensures:
1. Rule of law
2. Realisation of human rights
3. Prosperity and stability of the society

How many of the above statements are correct?

In which of the following types of cases the number of judges on a bench be less than 5:
1. Cases involving interpretation of the constitution
2. Advisory jurisdiction under Article 143
3. Death Penalty cases

How many of the above statements are correct?

Consider the following statements:
1. The constitution makes no provision for the appointment of the temporary or acting judges of the supreme court
2. The seat of the supreme court can be shifted from Delhi to any other place by the CJI only after the recommendation of the collegium

How many of the above statements are correct?
In which of the following matters the supreme court can withdrew a case pending before a high court(s) and dispose of the case by itself?

options.text: When the case involving same or substantially the same questions of law are pending before the SC or one of more high courts
When cases involving same or substantially the same questions of law and are pending before two or more high courts

question:
Consider the following statements:
1. To increase the number of judges in the supreme court, a constitutional amendment is required under Article 368 to be passed by the parliament
2. At the time of commencement of the constitution the supreme court strength was 8 i.e 7 judges and 1 chief justice

Which of the above statements are correct?

Consider the following statements:
1. rajya sabha was first constituted in 1950
2. The concept of upper house in India was introduced in GoI Act 1919
3. The GoI 1935 Act made the upper house as permanent house
4. Half of the members of rajya sabha retires in every two year

How many of the above statements are correct?

The president of India addresses both the houses of the parliament  together in which of the following instances
1. At the commencement of the first session after the general election of lok sabha
2. At the commencement of the first session each year
3. To discuss a bill on which there is a deadlock between lok sabha and rajya sabha

How many of the above statements are correct?

Consider the following statements regarding the ‘Motion of Thanks’:
1. Half an hour after the President’s address both the Houses of the Parliament meet in their
respective chambers where the copies of the President’s address are laid by the Union Minister
of Parliamentary Affairs.
2. Members of the Parliament are free to speak on all sorts of matters excluding those which are not specifically mentioned in the President’s address.

Select the correct option from below?

The 104th amendment Act, 2019 deals with:
1. Extension of reservation for SC/STs to the Lok Sabha and State Legislative Assemblies.
2. Discontinuation of reservation for the Anglo-Indian Community to the Lok Sabha and State
Legislative Assemblies.
3. Article 334 of the Indian Constitution.

How many of the above option are correct?

Consider the following statements:
1. The Speaker of the Lok Sabha is elected by the members of Lok Sabha by Effective Majority.
2. According to the Constitution, the Speaker has to be a member of the ruling party or a ruling
coalition.
3. In the warrant of precedence, the Speaker comes next only to the President, the Vice President, the Prime Minister and the Bharat Ratna awardees.

How many of the above option are correct?

The Speaker of the Lok Sabha is empowered to disqualify a member of the Lok Sabha on which of the following grounds:
1. Defection
2. Unruly behaviour
3. Office of Profit
4. When a member tears a bill copy and enters the well of the House

How many of the above option are correct?

Consider the following statements regarding the ‘Estimates Committee’:
1. It consists of 30 members from the Lok Sabha only.
2. It is also known as the ‘continuous economy committee’.
3. The Public Accounts Committee is known as the ‘twin sister’ of the Estimates Committee.
4. The Committee cannot examine the policy as approved by the Parliament.

How many of the above option are correct?

Consider the following statements regarding the Public Accounts Committee:
1. The PAC consists of 22 members.
2. Half of its members are from the Lok Sabha.
3. Since its inception, Rajya Sabha members have been part of the PAC.

How many of the above option are correct?

Consider the following statements:
1. There is a Business Advisory Committee only in the Lok Sabha.
2. The Speaker of the Lok Sabha is its ex-officio Chairman.

How many of the above option are correct?

Consider the following statements:
1. Each House of the Parliament has its own Committee on Subordinate Legislation.
2. The Committee consists of 15 members elected by the House.
3. The Committee only examines Acts and not bills.

How many of the above option are correct?

Consider the following statements:
1. States and Union territories have the authority to prepare and maintain, for their own purposes, a list of socially and educationally backward classes, entries in which may be different from the Central List.
2. National Commission for Backward Classes (NCBC) is a constitutional body.
3. National Commission for Backward Classes (NCBC) consists of a Chairperson, Vice-Chairperson and three other members.

How many of the above option are correct?

Which of the following statement(s) regarding PM CARES Fund:
1. The fund consists entirely of voluntary contributions from individuals/organizations and does not get any budgetary support.
2. Donations to PM CARES Fund would qualify for 100% exemption under the Income Tax Act.
3. Donations to PM CARES Fund qualify to be counted as Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR)
expenditure under the Companies Act.
4. PM CARES Fund has got exemption under the FCRA to accept donations and contributions from individuals and organisations based in foreign countries.

How many of the above option are correct?
Election Commission of India’s SVEEP is?

options.text: Its Flagship program for Voter education. #ans
Its proposal to extend online voting to the Non-Resident Indians
Its proposal to list all the criminal cases against the election candidates on its website.

question:
Consider the following statement(s) regarding a State Election Commissioner:
1. The SEC is appointed by the Governor of a State.
2. The tenure of the SEC is mentioned in the Constitution.
3. While a State Electoral Officer is a senior bureaucrat, no bureaucrat can be appointed as the
SEC.

How many of the above option are correct?

Consider the following statement(s) regarding Film Certificate Appellate Tribunal (FCAT):
1. FCAT was a statutory body set up by the Ministry of Information & Broadcasting in 1983.
2. Its main job was to hear appeals filed under Section 5C of the Cinematograph Act, by applicants
for certification aggrieved by the decision of the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC).
3. The tribunal was headed by a chairperson and had four other members.
4. The tribunal was abolished in the year 2021.

How many of the above option are correct?

Consider the following statement(s):
1.According to The Medical Termination of Pregnancy (Amendment) Act, 2021 a
pregnancy may be terminated by a registered medical practitioner(s) where the
length of the pregnancy does not exceed twenty four weeks.
2.The pregnancy caused by rape or a failure of contraceptive measure are no
grounds for the termination of pregnancy.

How many of the above option are correct?
